page.title: 04Wild Life
page.content: Mr. Davey took us to Tredydon Course Fishing to do some bird watching.First of all we saw three Magpies flying together.Then we saw a Pied Wagtail and some Buzzards flying around in circles.We also saw House Martins, swallows,bullfinches,a carrion crow,a spotted flycatcher,a collared dove,a woodpidgeon,a pheasant,a chiffchaff and a wren.Mr Davey said that it is possible to see much more than these species and thought it a pity we did not spot a heron. Throughout our visits we did not see any wild land animals though we saw plenty of evidence of their existence. At Rings Wood rabbit burrows and droppings were seen,and elsewhere rabbit fur was collected.We also had reports of Badgers living in Trevallett Wood.Many of these and other animals are considered pests by farmers.
